cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi ESE of Grand Turk Island (and 140 mi NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW then gradually turning northwest toward the Bahamas and the Florida Peninsula; forecast track brings the core near South Florida late Sunday and then northward up the peninsula toward Georgia.

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted yet for the Florida coast (only for Bahamas, Cuba, Hispaniola).
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings posted yet for the Florida coast (only for Bahamas, Cuba, Hispaniola).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire east coast of Florida, especially from the Keys through Cape Canaveral, then northward into Georgia and South Carolina.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are 82% likely within five days; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out (35% range inferred from 64-kt probabilities nearby).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potentially significant storm surge exceeding 3 ft is possible along the Space Coast if Irma parallels or crosses the peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands from Irma could bring 4â€“8 inches of rainfall with higher local totals, producing flash-flood potential in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning well ahead of the center; port operations will also face long-period swells and possible coastal erosion.
